alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 2:37PM MST until July 28 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 545 PM MST. * At 236 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Camp Verde, Sedona, Village At Oak Creek, Rimrock, Montezuma Well, Lake Montezuma, Mcguireville, Montezuma Castle National Monument, Page Springs, Cornville, Middle Verde, Stoneman Lake, Cottonwood, Wet Beaver Creek Campground, V Bar V Visitors Center and Red Rock State Park. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 211 and 223. Interstate 17 between mile markers 288 and 318. State Route 179 between mile markers 299 and 313. State Route 89A between mile markers 367 and 377. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Russell Wash, Spring Creek, Verde River, Beaver Creek, Dry Beaver Creek, Brady Canyon, Rarick Canyon, Grief Hill Wash, Gaddis Wash, Walker Creek, Cherry Creek, Oak Creek, Turkey Creek, Dry Creek, Rattlesnake Canyon, West Clear Creek, Jacks Canyon and Long Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
